themes.label: Advanced pawn
themes.description: One of your pawns is deep into the opponent position, maybe threatening to promote.

themes.label: Advantage
themes.description: Seize your chance to get a decisive advantage. (200cp ≤ eval ≤ 600cp)

themes.label: Anastasia's mate
themes.description: A knight and rook or queen team up to trap the opposing king between the side of the board and a friendly piece.

themes.label: Arabian mate
themes.description: A knight and a rook team up to trap the opposing king on a corner of the board.

themes.label: Attacking f2 or f7
themes.description: An attack focusing on the f2 or f7 pawn, such as in the fried liver opening.

themes.label: Attraction
themes.description: An exchange or sacrifice encouraging or forcing an opponent piece to a square that allows a follow-up tactic.

themes.label: Back rank mate
themes.description: Checkmate the king on the home rank, when it is trapped there by its own pieces.

themes.label: Bishop endgame
themes.description: An endgame with only bishops and pawns.

themes.label: Boden's mate
themes.description: Two attacking bishops on criss-crossing diagonals deliver mate to a king obstructed by friendly pieces.

themes.label: Castling
themes.description: Bring the king to safety, and deploy the rook for attack.

themes.label: Capture the defender
themes.description: Removing a piece that is critical to defence of another piece, allowing the now undefended piece to be captured on a following move.

themes.label: Crushing
themes.description: Spot the opponent blunder to obtain a crushing advantage. (eval ≥ 600cp)

themes.label: Double bishop mate
themes.description: Two attacking bishops on adjacent diagonals deliver mate to a king obstructed by friendly pieces.

themes.label: Dovetail mate
themes.description: A queen delivers mate to an adjacent king, whose only two escape squares are obstructed by friendly pieces.

themes.label: Equality
themes.description: Come back from a losing position, and secure a draw or a balanced position. (eval ≤ 200cp)

themes.label: Kingside attack
themes.description: An attack of the opponent's king, after they castled on the king side.

themes.label: Clearance
themes.description: A move, often with tempo, that clears a square, file or diagonal for a follow-up tactical idea.

themes.label: Defensive move
themes.description: A precise move or sequence of moves that is needed to avoid losing material or another advantage.

themes.label: Deflection
themes.description: A move that distracts an opponent piece from another duty that it performs, such as guarding a key square. Sometimes also called "overloading".

themes.label: Discovered attack
themes.description: Moving a piece (such as a knight), that previously blocked an attack by a long range piece (such as a rook), out of the way of that piece.

themes.label: Double check
themes.description: Checking with two pieces at once, as a result of a discovered attack where both the moving piece and the unveiled piece attack the opponent's king.

themes.label: Endgame
themes.description: A tactic during the last phase of the game.

themes.label: En Passant
themes.description: A tactic involving the en passant rule, where a pawn can capture an opponent pawn that has bypassed it using its initial two-square move.

themes.label: Exposed king
themes.description: A tactic involving a king with few defenders around it, often leading to checkmate.

themes.label: Fork
themes.description: A move where the moved piece attacks two opponent pieces at once.

themes.label: Hanging piece
themes.description: A tactic involving an opponent piece being undefended or insufficiently defended and free to capture.

themes.label: Hook mate
themes.description: Checkmate with a rook, knight, and pawn along with one enemy pawn to limit the enemy king's escape.

themes.label: Interference
themes.description: Moving a piece between two opponent pieces to leave one or both opponent pieces undefended, such as a knight on a defended square between two rooks.

themes.label: Intermezzo
themes.description: Instead of playing the expected move, first interpose another move posing an immediate threat that the opponent must answer. Also known as "Zwischenzug" or "In between".

themes.label: Knight endgame
themes.description: An endgame with only knights and pawns.

themes.label: Long puzzle
themes.description: Three moves to win.

themes.label: Master games
themes.description: Puzzles from games played by titled players.

themes.label: Master vs Master games
themes.description: Puzzles from games between two titled players.

themes.label: Checkmate
themes.description: Win the game with style.

themes.label: Mate in 1
themes.description: Deliver checkmate in one move.

themes.label: Mate in 2
themes.description: Deliver checkmate in two moves.

themes.label: Mate in 3
themes.description: Deliver checkmate in three moves.

themes.label: Mate in 4
themes.description: Deliver checkmate in four moves.

themes.label: Mate in 5 or more
themes.description: Figure out a long mating sequence.

themes.label: Middlegame
themes.description: A tactic during the second phase of the game.

themes.label: One-move puzzle
themes.description: A puzzle that is only one move long.

themes.label: Opening
themes.description: A tactic during the first phase of the game.

themes.label: Pawn endgame
themes.description: An endgame with only pawns.

themes.label: Pin
themes.description: A tactic involving pins, where a piece is unable to move without revealing an attack on a higher value piece.

themes.label: Promotion
themes.description: Promote one of your pawn to a queen or minor piece.

themes.label: Queen endgame
themes.description: An endgame with only queens and pawns.

themes.label: Queen and Rook
themes.description: An endgame with only queens, rooks and pawns.

themes.label: Queenside attack
themes.description: An attack of the opponent's king, after they castled on the queen side.

themes.label: Quiet move
themes.description: A move that does neither make a check or capture, nor an immediate threat to capture, but does prepare a more hidden unavoidable threat for a later move.

themes.label: Rook endgame
themes.description: An endgame with only rooks and pawns.

themes.label: Sacrifice
themes.description: A tactic involving giving up material in the short-term, to gain an advantage again after a forced sequence of moves.

themes.label: Short puzzle
themes.description: Two moves to win.

themes.label: Skewer
themes.description: A motif involving a high value piece being attacked, moving out the way, and allowing a lower value piece behind it to be captured or attacked, the inverse of a pin.

themes.label: Smothered mate
themes.description: A checkmate delivered by a knight in which the mated king is unable to move because it is surrounded (or smothered) by its own pieces.

themes.label: Super GM games
themes.description: Puzzles from games played by the best players in the world.

themes.label: Trapped piece
themes.description: A piece is unable to escape capture as it has limited moves.

themes.label: Underpromotion
themes.description: Promotion to a knight, bishop, or rook.

themes.label: Very long puzzle
themes.description: Four moves or more to win.

themes.label: X-Ray attack
themes.description: A piece attacks or defends a square, through an enemy piece.

themes.label: Zugzwang
themes.description: The opponent is limited in the moves they can make, and all moves worsen their position.

themes.label: Healthy mix
themes.description: A bit of everything. You don't know what to expect, so you remain ready for anything! Just like in real games.

themes.label: Player games
themes.description: Lookup puzzles generated from your games, or from another player's games.
